answers.answer: As the lable said...ask your doctor.But, in any case it is best to be safe then sorry.  I have gotten into the habit of reading the labels on everything.  Even sunscreen and makeup.  Over careful?  Maybe.I have had a bad reaction to a cough syrup  because of not reading a label.  A lady in my support group had a reaction to a brand of sunscreen.  Too bad it was awhile back and she forgot the name.  She did tell us the doctor told her it may have been something in the sunscreen.  I don't take chances.Usually the warning is on over the counter medications , but check everything

I have found that I can get the jitters with some of the otc meds that carry the warning if I take them too close to my Synthroid.The technical answer would be to ask your Dr. -- and you may want to do a community search on upper rt. hand side that may bring up some other posts ..
